definition: to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: Three is the enterprise risk factors incomputable.
sentences.chinese: 三是对本企业的危险因素底数不清。

sentences.english: I got one keyhole and about a zillion keys. You do the math.
sentences.chinese: 只有一个钥匙孔和数不清的钥匙，你自己算吧。

sentences.english: The candidate delivers countless speeches and shakes countless hands.
sentences.chinese: 他们发表数不清的演说，同数不清的人握手。

sentences.english: The candidate delivers countless speeches and shakes countless hands.
sentences.chinese: 他们发表数不清的演说，同数不清的人握手。
窜入记忆里的还有数不清的体育赛事。

sentences.english: In my life, there are thousands of time saying hi and goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 回首一生，数不清有多少次说哈罗和再见。

sentences.english: It looked very gorgeous. If you wanted to enter this building, you need to climb countless steps.
sentences.chinese: 但是如果想靠近，对不起，你得爬数不清的台阶才行。

sentences.english: There are thousands of people who do not have homes or shelters.
sentences.chinese: 有数不清的人没有家或住所。

sentences.english: More times than I can count.
The World Wide Web has an awesome collection of dingbat fonts out there.
sentences.chinese: 互联网上有数不清的丁巴特字体。

sentences.english: I must have a zillion pictures of Mom and me smiling together.
sentences.chinese: 我和妈妈在一起微笑的照片一定多得都数不清了。

sentences.english: That was in a dream, where there were countless flickering glows of lights.
sentences.chinese: 那是在梦中，梦里是浓雾数不清的点点灯火光辉。

sentences.english: Untold millions of believers have served him faithfully under despotic governments.
sentences.chinese: 数不清的信徒是在暴虐专横的政府之下忠心地服事主。

sentences.english: So will there arise much contempt and wrath.
sentences.chinese: 这样一定会惹起数不清的麻烦和不满。

sentences.english: The birds on Bird Island are countless.
sentences.chinese: 鸟岛的鸟多得数不清了。

sentences.english: At that time there are numerous river fish.
sentences.chinese: 那个时候河里面有数不清的鱼。

definition: lit. their number cannot be counted (idiom); fig. countless/innumerable
lit. each color and each form (idiom)/diverse/various/all kinds of
hundreds/a large number/lit. by the hundreds and thousands
lit. by the thousands and tens of thousands (idiom); untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands
move (in chess, on stage, in martial arts)/gambit/trick/scheme/movement/same as 招數|招数[zhao1 shu4]
numerous and close together/densely packed/thickly dotted/thick/dense
